text: Understand others to build influence
Leverage shared values for collaboration
IF  THEN Build collaborative networks to achieve goals
CLAIM: Influence is a fundamental driver of personal and organizational success
Influence stems from personal connections and shared experiences.
Everyone has the potential to influence others through their interactions.
IF  THEN Influence develops gradually through repeated interactions.
IF  THEN The influence of any individual is amplified by the people they impact.
CLAIM: Every person, regardless of profession or status, has inherent influence.
CLAIM: Influence is a universal human capacity that exists in all relationships.
Honesty in all dealings
Transparency in actions
Long-term value over short-term gains
Consistency in ethical behavior
IF  THEN Be transparent in all professional and personal interactions
IF  THEN Maintain integrity even in small or seemingly insignificant matters
IF  THEN Value reputation and trust above convenience or expediency
CLAIM: Integrity is essential for influence and success
CLAIM: Ethical behavior leads to sustainable professional and personal fulfillment
CLAIM: The consequences of unethical behavior outweigh any immediate benefits
Maintaining high morale enhances resilience and the ability to overcome challenges.
Self-esteem is foundational to personal motivation and success across life domains.
IF  THEN Actively encourage others to foster their self-esteem and sense of belonging.
IF  THEN Prioritize others' needs and emotional well-being in decision-making.
CLAIM: Low self-esteem creates invisible barriers to achieving personal potential.
CLAIM: Self-confidence has a greater impact on academic achievement than IQ.
Effective listening requires focused attention and present-moment awareness.
Developing listening skills is foundational to effective communication and leadership.
IF  THEN Maintain eye contact during conversations to enhance comprehension.
IF  THEN Avoid making assumptions about individuals based on group stereotypes.
IF  THEN Prioritize listening over personal concerns or distractions during interactions.
IF  THEN Resolve personal emotional biases before engaging in active listening.
CLAIM: Active listening improves comprehension and reduces misunderstandings.
CLAIM: The majority of daily communication time is spent listening (45%).
Understanding others' perspectives leads to effective collaboration.
Overcoming egocentrism improves decision-making.
IF  THEN Assume ideas will be rejected unless proven otherwise.
IF  THEN Maintain authority to discourage suggestions.
IF  THEN Prioritize clarity to avoid misunderstandings.
CLAIM: Fear of rejection suppresses employee innovation.
CLAIM: Unclear communication reduces productivity.
Focus on others' internal states and perspectives to effectively influence and solve problems.
IF  THEN Develop problem-solving skills through practice and mentorship.
IF  THEN Maintain patience and persistence when facing obstacles to achieve goals.
CLAIM: True friendship is characterized by active listening, support, correction, and celebration of success.
Relationships are built through active engagement and shared understanding.
Effective communication requires adaptation to others' perspectives and motivations.
IF  THEN Leaders must initiate contact to build connections.
IF  THEN Communication should align with the recipient's personality type for effectiveness.
CLAIM: The ability to understand and meet others' needs enhances influence.
CLAIM: There are four primary personality types: Sanguine, Melancholic, Phlegmatic, and Choleric.
Invest time in relationships to build influence and trust.
Empower others by providing opportunities and support.
Strong connections create environments for shared growth and success.
IF  THEN Make judgment calls in service interactions without rigid rules.
IF  THEN Communicate vision to align others with shared goals.
IF  THEN Allow flexibility in processes to accommodate unique situations.
CLAIM: Strengthening others multiplies influence and creates cascading impact.
CLAIM: Great service stems from treating people as valued partners.
CLAIM: Relationships built on trust outperform transactional connections.
Empower individuals by transferring authority and enabling independent action.
Leadership growth occurs through delegation of responsibility and opportunities for success.
IF  THEN Delegate tasks when others can perform them with at least 80% effectiveness.
IF  THEN Address errors and challenges privately while providing constructive feedback.
IF  THEN Show confidence publicly to build trust and legitimacy.
CLAIM: Effective empowerment leads to organizational growth and improved performance.
Leadership development requires internal transformation.
Team focus enables sustainable growth.
IF  THEN Assess team development using the five-stage model.
IF  THEN Develop leaders through intentional mentorship and empowerment.
CLAIM: 70% of leaders fail to develop others effectively.
CLAIM: Effective leadership development creates a multiplier effect.
